meanings.definition: Thin and flexible like a wire.
meanings.sent1: The wirier branches of the tree swayed gently in the wind.
meanings.sent2: Her hair became wirier after she braided it tightly.
meanings.sent3: The wirier rope was so thin, it almost disappeared against the sky.
meanings.sent4: His wirier frame allowed him to slip through the crowd unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The wirier vines wrapped around the fence, creating a natural barrier.

meanings.definition: Having more wires or wire-like qualities.
meanings.sent1: The wirier headphones were more durable than the others.
meanings.sent2: The wirier cables were able to transmit data faster.
meanings.sent3: She joked that his wirier phone charger looked like a snake.
meanings.sent4: The wirier fence seemed to symbolize strength and security.
meanings.sent5: The wirier net caught more fish than the regular one.
